Posted By: ZEvilMustache (9/25/2010 6:48:40 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
On constructed: If you're running red artifact hate, I think you'll reach for [Manic Vandal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Manic Vandal) or [Oxidda Scrapmelter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Oxidda Scrapmelter).
  
On limited: Wow. Some people really don't get it. [Shatter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shatter) has *never* been good in a vacuum, and never will. The whole point in reprinting it (both in Scars and the original Mirrodin set) was allowing it and its simple design to shine. And boy, does it shine. This is an easily first-pickable card in draft, no questions asked.
posts.html:
On constructed: If you're running red artifact hate, I think you'll reach for Manic Vandal or Oxidda Scrapmelter.
On limited: Wow. Some people really don't get it. Shatter has never been good in a vacuum, and never will. The whole point in reprinting it (both in Scars and the original Mirrodin set) was allowing it and its simple design to shine. And boy, does it shine. This is an easily first-pickable card in draft, no questions asked.

Posted By: StoicChampion (9/23/2010 5:48:34 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I would have to agree with Condor\_96. Please stop claiming cards are strictly better or worse than other cards when it just isn't true. I agree that [Shattering Spree](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shattering Spree) is a better overall card, but claiming it is strictly better just shows you to be an inexperienced player. One extra mana for the speed increase may be worth it in some decks.  
You could claim this card is strictly worse than [Shattering Pulse](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shattering Pulse), and that would be a better argument, since Shattering Pulse does everything this does at the same speed and cost, but with buyback potential. Of course, Shattering Pulse hasn't been playable in most tournaments for a long time, so even then the "strictly worse" argument is somewhat flawed.
posts.html:
I would have to agree with Condor_96. Please stop claiming cards are strictly better or worse than other cards when it just isn't true. I agree that Shattering Spree is a better overall card, but claiming it is strictly better just shows you to be an inexperienced player. One extra mana for the speed increase may be worth it in some decks.
You could claim this card is strictly worse than Shattering Pulse, and that would be a better argument, since Shattering Pulse does everything this does at the same speed and cost, but with buyback potential. Of course, Shattering Pulse hasn't been playable in most tournaments for a long time, so even then the "strictly worse" argument is somewhat flawed.
